intro: Rourea ovalifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leaf rourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its large, oval-shaped leaves that are often pubescent on the underside. It produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. Rourea ovalifoliolata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
